title: We are no longer a nation of shopkeepers - and better for it
text:
We are, as Napoleon so memorably if possibly apocryphally put it, a nation of shopkeepers. Our high streets are dense with small outlets selling just about anything you can imagine. Our towns are circled by out-of-town malls filled with giant retail sheds.

Our airports have been turned into places to buy things with a runway off on the side somewhere and surveys show that shopping is among our most popular leisure activities (three-quarters of us say we enjoy it, in case you were wondering) – just behind watching TV. If there is one thing the British are really good at it is hammering their credit card when out adding to their wardrobe or choosing something to decorate the house with.
